alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Teton, southeastern Fremont and northeastern Madison Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Drummond, or 13 miles west of Felt, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ashton, Marysville, Drummond, Ashton Reservoir, Warm River and Ashton Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Big Hole Mountains; Centennial Mountains, Island Park; Teton Valley; Upper Snake River Plain
